Reviews.Title: Great with SPB Mobile Shell 3.0
Reviews.Author: Samuel A. Mcgarity
Reviews.Content: This phone hasn't gotten as much hype because the operating system that came as default was pretty bad.  Once I installed SPB Mobile Shell 3.0, it turned my phone into an awesome phone.  You can customize everything and I would say it's very similar to Google's new android phone.  The camera is great at 5.0 megapixs.  The wifi, FM Radio, internet browser, built in mail, Excel, Work, Power Point.  This phone is the real deal and much better and more customizable than the iPhone.  Not to mention it comes with 8 GB of storage.  I would strongly recommend this phone!!!

Reviews.Title: Would never purchase this phone again.
Reviews.Author: Frustrated
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Samsung Omnia in August 2009.  I have had to hard reset it countless times, adjust the memory (from main to storage to card) and have had to replace it TWICE for technical problems.  The LCD light went out in January and after receiving my replacement, the phone only had one-way audio - that's helpful.  I have spent over a week without a business phone and have had calls forwarded to my personal cell.  Verizon's solution to my problem was to send a second, refurbished phone with the hopes that "everything would work in the phone."  They also offered an additional 150 minutes.  Wow - thanks!  What a disappointing phone.  I don't know how it ever received 4/5 stars.  I'm ready to move my business elsewhere - maybe an iphone's in my future.
